<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; This function takes a string with the passes that should be used. The format</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; of this string is the same as opt&#39;s -passes argument for the new pass</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; manager. Individual passes may be specified, separated by commas. Full</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; Specify a custom alias analysis pipeline for the PassBuilder to be used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; instead of the default one. The string argument is not copied; the caller</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; is responsible for ensuring it outlives the PassBuilderOptions instance.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
